channel.title: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month
channel.description:
Taharok: This topic is for voting for 2 different features: 1. A separation of the tutorial section into a main board where the best tutorials are placed and a child board where all regular tutorials are posted by members 2. A creation of a "tutorial of the month" recognition award, where the best tutorials are judged under undecided criteria and the owner is rewarded with a badge recognizing them as an outstanding tutorial author, for exactly one month.
[hr]
I feel as if we should implement the approval system for the Tutorial Section again.
I know we've done this in the past, but we reverted back to free-for-all.
I'm not sure if it's a forum issue or just mitb's decision to stop that process?
[hr]
[quote="asshole_rule"]Sort of like Signature of the week, same concept.
In an order to get our tutorials section here at Moparscape booming with new tutorials monthly which we all would love, and I'm sure could attract some more people, I'm presenting the idea of tutorial of the month. It is simply a competition to see who's tutorial is the most unique, and the most helpful. It would be a lot of fun competing for the best tutorial imo, and like I said, get some new tutorials in the tutorial section which is desperately needed.
Of course some obvious rules applied, like only your own work, and what not...[/quote]

item.title: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

The new setup has been implemented. If you consider it inadequate or incomplete in any way, please post a new topic in this section and we’ll respond to it as soon as we’re able to.

For now, this topic is resolved.

Read full topic
item.source: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month

item.title: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Snippet section, yes.

Also, the tutorial section needs to become approval only again. It’s getting out of hand. “Tutorials” are made over the same thing 3-5 times a day. “How to change the drops” is not a fucking tutorial. There probably needs to be one big starter tutorial with the basics, and then the rest should be decent, actual, thought out tutorials. But as it is right now, it’s ridiculous. Something needs to be done.

I’m aware that this would take a large amount of moderation in the beginning, so just appoint new moderators. There are plenty of people who would be able and willing to moderate the tutorial section.

Read full topic
item.source: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month

item.title: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

number 1 = support

number 2 = support

Number 3(?) = no support, i feel mods may be to harsh and decline some tuts that might be semi useful for ripping out methods that other tuts which do the same may have and so forth.
May i add i think that their should be a snippet section? Not just one thread with lots of snippets, i cba looking through a thread…

Read full topic
item.source: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month

item.title: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:126, topic:444096”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=546780.msg4023274#msg4023274 date=1340158618]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=546780.msg4023255#msg4023255 date=1340158222]

tutorial of the month is defo a contest…

atleast i planned it to be a contest and I kinda suggested it.
[/quote]Errr, it would not be a contest as we know it, it would be a tutorial chosen that week/month/whatever (not necessarily made that month, etc) to be of good quality so it ‘wins’. At least that’s what I think would work if we were to do it (mind you, I voted no on the contest part).

Well that just took all the possible fun out of it.
[/quote]Well the point is people should be ALWAYS striving to make good tutorials in the section, not only making a good tutorial to submit for the contest and try and win an award.[/quote]

So why can’t it be a competition? It’s not like it’s going to hurt anything. It’ll be a lot more interesting imho.

Read full topic

item.source: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month

item.title: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:113, topic:444096”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=546780.msg4021710#msg4021710 date=1340056950]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=546780.msg4021288#msg4021288 date=1340042653]

[quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=546780.msg4021207#msg4021207 date=1340037207]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=546780.msg4020899#msg4020899 date=1340006762]

^ pretty much sums it up David. Just because a mooderator has contributed one way or another ( davidscape, highscores, etc ) does not mean they are the experts in that field to say "okay this tutorial is really good and helps people to learn blah "

Now…if those with specific badges had a say so such as “rs2 programmer” or “java guru” then yes they may have a fair chance of voting on tutorials.
[/quote]I think you are misinterpreting what Taharok is saying.

There have been much larger and more popular tutorials/topics for the older staff members. That doesn’t matter though. Not all of the current vets would have been vets if not for them being staff first. Based on Lothy’s concept of the vet rank, most of the staff shouldn’t have access to it. I’m not trying to be mean or a jerk, it’s simply the truth. The rank is based on contribution to the actual development of rsps and only a few mods have contributed enough to earn that rank. That’s not to say they shouldn’t be honored with another rank that is the equivalent of mitb’s community member, though.
[/quote]I didn’t know we were talking about vet, I thought we were talking about judging tutorials? These, er, normal members (;)) are implying that we don’t know enough to judge a tutorial. I would like to beg to differ, I don’t think you need to be an ‘expert’ of any field to judge a tutorial. If anything you should be mediocre, because then you can judge how well the tutorial teaches (which is what is important) instead of just being nitpicky at the content. In which case you may as well search the entire internet for the most knowledgeable person so that you can make sure every little detail is correct :rolleyes: And then I wouldn’t even call vets ‘experts’ either.

A few posts back you pretty much said all mods are qualified to judge, I’m not implying that you don’t know enough to judge a tutorial. I just don’t think ALL of them should be judges just because they’re moderators.

I’m pretty sure all of us have written a quality tutorial or made a good contribution (development wise) of some sort. I’d be happy to throw together a list for you for each moderator?

Are you not implying with that sentence that all mods are qualified?
[/quote]Indeed I am. I do not believe there is a single moderator dumb enough to not be able to judge a tutorial and tell if it is well written.

That may be right, but it brings us back to what tL said >.<
[/quote]What tL said was not about this, and Loveandpower quoting it was completely out of context. It may still be somewhat relevant, but to give you brief context it was about reputation, not ‘judging’ anything.[/quote]

W/e doesn’t matter let’s get it started

Read full topic
item.source: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month

Not all of the current vets would have been vets if not for them being staff first. Based on Lothy’s concept of the vet rank, most of the staff shouldn’t have access to it. I’m not trying to be mean or a jerk, it’s simply the truth. The rank is based on contribution to the actual development of rsps and only a few mods have contributed enough to earn that rank. That’s not to say they shouldn’t be honored with another rank that is the equivalent of mitb’s community member, though.
[/quote]I didn’t know we were talking about vet, I thought we were talking about judging tutorials? These, er, normal members (;)) are implying that we don’t know enough to judge a tutorial. I would like to beg to differ, I don’t think you need to be an ‘expert’ of any field to judge a tutorial. If anything you should be mediocre, because then you can judge how well the tutorial teaches (which is what is important) instead of just being nitpicky at the content. In which case you may as well search the entire internet for the most knowledgeable person so that you can make sure every little detail is correct :rolleyes: And then I wouldn’t even call vets ‘experts’ either.

A few posts back you pretty much said all mods are qualified to judge, I’m not implying that you don’t know enough to judge a tutorial. I just don’t think ALL of them should be judges just because they’re moderators.

I’m pretty sure all of us have written a quality tutorial or made a good contribution (development wise) of some sort. I’d be happy to throw together a list for you for each moderator?

Are you not implying with that sentence that all mods are qualified?
[/quote]Indeed I am. I do not believe there is a single moderator dumb enough to not be able to judge a tutorial and tell if it is well written.

That may be right, but it brings us back to what tL said >.<[/quote]What tL said was not about this, and Loveandpower quoting it was completely out of context. It may still be somewhat relevant, but to give you brief context it was about reputation, not ‘judging’ anything.

item.title: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:108, topic:444096”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=546780.msg4021454#msg4021454 date=1340048976]
David that’s like saying “all moderators are java gurus” which is obviously not true.
[/quote]

Not at all. Can you go to ehow and read a random tutorial about chopping a pineapple and judge how well the topic was taught, even if you had no previous culinary experience with pineapples? He’s talking about competence, not specific knowledge.[/quote]not entirely true.

A tutorial shouldn’t be voted upon how “competent” it is but how useful to the community as a whole it has been.

Read full topic
item.source: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month

item.title: Tutorial section & tutorial of the month
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:106, topic:444096”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=546780.msg4021207#msg4021207 date=1340037207]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=546780.msg4020899#msg4020899 date=1340006762]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=546780.msg4020847#msg4020847 date=1340000132]
^ pretty much sums it up David. Just because a mooderator has contributed one way or another ( davidscape, highscores, etc ) does not mean they are the experts in that field to say "okay this tutorial is really good and helps people to learn blah "

Now…if those with specific badges had a say so such as “rs2 programmer” or “java guru” then yes they may have a fair chance of voting on tutorials.
[/quote]I think you are misinterpreting what Taharok is saying.

There have been much larger and more popular tutorials/topics for the older staff members. That doesn’t matter though. Not all of the current vets would have been vets if not for them being staff first. Based on Lothy’s concept of the vet rank, most of the staff shouldn’t have access to it. I’m not trying to be mean or a jerk, it’s simply the truth. The rank is based on contribution to the actual development of rsps and only a few mods have contributed enough to earn that rank. That’s not to say they shouldn’t be honored with another rank that is the equivalent of mitb’s community member, though.
[/quote]I didn’t know we were talking about vet, I thought we were talking about judging tutorials? These, er, normal members (;)) are implying that we don’t know enough to judge a tutorial. I would like to beg to differ, I don’t think you need to be an ‘expert’ of any field to judge a tutorial. If anything you should be mediocre, because then you can judge how well the tutorial teaches (which is what is important) instead of just being nitpicky at the content. In which case you may as well search the entire internet for the most knowledgeable person so that you can make sure every little detail is correct :rolleyes: And then I wouldn’t even call vets ‘experts’ either.

A few posts back you pretty much said all mods are qualified to judge, I’m not implying that you don’t know enough to judge a tutorial. I just don’t think ALL of them should be judges just because they’re moderators.

I’m pretty sure all of us have written a quality tutorial or made a good contribution (development wise) of some sort. I’d be happy to throw together a list for you for each moderator?

Are you not implying with that sentence that all mods are qualified?
[/quote]Indeed I am. I do not believe there is a single moderator dumb enough to not be able to judge a tutorial and tell if it is well written.[/quote]

That may be right, but it brings us back to what tL said >.<
